Question
========
A researcher observes that in his dataset with repeated measurements, the assumption of sphericity does not hold. He also notices that there is a lot of *missing data*. Which technique can best deal with violation of the assumption of sphericity and presence of missing data, and is therefore the most appropriate?

Answerlist
----------
* Multivariate ANOVA (MANOVA).
* Repeated measures ANOVA.
* Covariance analysis (ANCOVA).
* Linear mixed model.
